basics.summary: A computational atmospheric scientist working from weather to decadal timescales.

work.name: NSF National Center for Atmospheric Research, Boulder, Colorado
work.summary: Ported my NHD HOMME model to the Stormspeed fork of the Community Earth System Model, working under Dr. Peter Lauritzen

work.summary: Ph.D. work advised by Professor Christiane Jablonowski

work.name: University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Michigan
work.summary: Developed a novel idealzed dynamical core test case to validate interactions between topography and precipitation.

work.name: Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory, Cold Spring Harbor, New York
work.summary: Helped develop an interpretable machine learning model to learn Langevin-based models of neuronal dynamics.

_volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

courses: Studied the dynamics of the deep atmosphere in the HOMME dynamical core.
Studied a combination of rigorous mathematical analysis and numerical methods.

awards.title: NSF Graduate Research Fellowship Honorable Mention
awards.summary: The NSF GRFP recognizes and supports outstanding graduate students in NSF-supported STEM disciplines

publications.name: Mountain-Induced Moist Baroclinic Wave Test Case for the Dynamical Cores of Atmospheric General Circulation Models
publications.summary: A novel test case for atmospheric dynamical cores, which validates the correct behavior of moist processes with idealized topography.

publications.name: The fully coupled regionally refined model of E3SM version 2: overview of the atmosphere, land, and river results.
publications.summary: Validation of a regionally refined configuration of the Energy Exascale Earth System Model (E3SM) version 2

publications.name: Learning non-stationary Langevin dynamics from stochastic observations of latent trajectories.
publications.summary: A machine learning framework for learning interpretable Langevin models of neuronal dynamics from spike train data.

publications.name: Real-Time Certified Probabilistic Pedestrian Forecasting
publications.summary: An optimization algorithm for real-time probabilistic forecasting of pedestrian trajectories with formal safety guarantees.
